titleStmt.title: Na-Ca carbonates at high pressure: new hosts of deep carbon

analytic.title: Na-Ca carbonates at high pressure: new hosts of deep carbon

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

startPage=-1, endPage=-1, consolidateCitations=1, consolidateHeader=1, consolidateFunders=0, includeRawAffiliations=false, includeRawCitations=true, includeRawCopyrights=false, generateTeiIds=false, generateTeiCoordinates=[], flavor=null

div.p: Na 4 Ca(CO 3 ) 3 shows symmetry change from cubic to rhombohedral at pressures above 10 GPa, however without abrupt changes in a parameter and unit cell volume (Fig. 2): Crystals of Na 2 Ca(CO 3 ) 2 and Na 1.64 K 0.36 Ca(CO 3 ) 2 were compressed up to 10 GPa, and currently only c unit cell parameter is obtained from diffraction data due to complex twinning and modulation of the structure. No abrupt changes in this parameter, however, are observed in the studied pressure range (Fig. 3):

figure.head: Figure 2 .
figure.figDesc: Figure 2. Dependence of Na 4 Ca(CO 3 ) 3 unit cell parameters and volume on pressure

figure.head: Figure 3 .
figure.figDesc: Figure 3. Dependence of unit cell parameter c on pressure for Na 2 Ca(CO 3 ) 2 and Na 1.64 K 0.36 Ca(CO 3 ) 2
